Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: The Sabre Code of Conduct outlines the governing principles key to establishing and maintaining trust with our employees, clients-

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, kill me!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey! All right, obviously we all want to die but we have to get through this. So, Gabe go ahead. It's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh, is it okay with you? Because if it's not, you work for me, so... Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, policies and contracts governing our business. Be honest, fair-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispers to Jim] I'm gonna do it.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: And trustworthy in all your business activities and relationships. Treat one another-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! I'm going into labor! Oh my goodness!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh okay, she's going into labor. Make way, everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know it's wrong to fake going into labor just to get out of things, but sometimes it's necessary.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [after Angela gives her a stack of files]: I'm going into labor!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Or should I have corndogs. I mean-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm going into labor!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, three reasons you are wrong about True Blood. Number one-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm going into labor.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey guys, uh, can't keep saying you're going into labor. Everyone knows you're full of it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's not fair, you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Pitiful.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: It's stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Never cry wolf.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. [liquid splatters]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Oh! Oh my goodness!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm really in labor! This is happening!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay guys, here we go! We'll see you!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How do you feel?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Drive carefully!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Good luck!

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Goodbye! Good luck! [empty bottle falls to the ground]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: False alarm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on the phone] What?! They took another client from us? Okay, bye. Man! Business is war! Customers, clients- it's like a war out there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am a leader. But you can only inspire people so much in a place like this. So today I'm turning the inspire-factor up to ten with a little help from my friend America's bloodiest battle.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why even read business books? We should be studying war. Going to places like Gettysburg. Where is that?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's right here in PA.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [gags, coughs] Well we should take a fieldtrip there. I mean, that would be so cool. I wonder if that bus downstairs is-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay, Andy, we get it. It's a trip to Gettysburg.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That sounds super inspiring! I'm in!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gettysburg? Hmm. Could be interesting. Second-most northern battle in the Civil War.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Actually it is the northernmost.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Civil War history industry has conveniently forgotten about the battle of Schrute Farms. [scoffs] Whatever. I'm over it. It's just grossly irresponsible.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Charge!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, this could be fun. I-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, the bus has free wifi and I made special low-sugar lunches for everyone. And is anyone kosher or halal?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's the halal option?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dates, tabbouleh, and a bagel with cream cheese.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, it's the same as the kosher option. There's a lesson in there. I mean, I can't force you to go. You're not my slaves. Thanks to Gettysburg. But... who's coming with me?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm in too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Guess I'm a sucker for historical fiction.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Anyone who's not going, you're dead to me. You're uninvited. I don't want you to come. But, FYI, there will be leftover turkey and pesto sammies in the fridge.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [passes out hats] One for you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Cool. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And one for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cool. Thanks. [puts his hat on Erin's head]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And- oh. You missed your head. [laughs and puts hat on Jim's head] There you go. Phyllis, think fast!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right, guys, a little foreplay before we do it. Fans of Ken Burns' Jazz will most certainly enjoy Civil War.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You know, I just got Limitless on my iPad. I bet I could get it on the TV.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ooh. Isn't that the one where the guy becomes limitless?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's just not appropri- I mean, if we were going to visit Bradley Cooper's birthplace, I'd be the first one suggesting it. I'd be rooting for it.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Limitless! Limitless! Limitless! Limitless!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right, all right, all right.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Not food and stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here. Like it?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, if you buy the picnic table then you've got to get the fire pit.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't get a fire pit. I have two babies.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The fire pit is a no-brainer.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oh, hi there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Plants and- hi, Robert! Hey, um, how are you doing? Good to see you again.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Where is everyone? Where is Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Andy took some of the other people on a corporate retreat to Gettysburg.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well, I was hoping to talk out some ideas with Andy. But what we have here... is perhaps better. By not going on the trip, you've shown you're the free-thinkers of the office.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Robert, you got your sheep and you got your black sheep, and I'm not even a sheep. I'm on the freaking moon.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: So, here what we can do. Game changers- changes to the game such that the game can never be played the same way again. Everyone, brainstorm some innovations. Don't be afraid to get weird with it. Meredith! [wakes her up] Excited!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [tries stapler/marker combo] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You guys...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: J-j-j-ju...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Get excited!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Shh! Movie's almost over.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right! We're here. Limitless can wait.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Fun fact. In France, they call Limitless 'The Man with Many Capabilities.'

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Woo-hoo! Ladies and gentlemen the eighteen hundreds await you. We can watch Limitless on the way back.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I got Source Code on the way back.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Ooh! All right!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Woo!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa, where you going?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Visitor center. Gonna grab a map for the memorials, right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, we're not going to the visitor center. We're not tourists.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, of course we're not tourists. We're just people that aren't from here who are taking a tour.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, sign says "Begin tour here."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Unless you're going on the very specially-created and meticulously-researched Andy Bernard tour.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: After Chancellorsville, Lee brought his army up the Shenandoah Valley, right through here! They stopped in this field for a picnic, which they called lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Yeah, but I'm confused...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Total deaths belongs to Gettysburg but when you're talking about D.P.A., that's deaths per acre...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...nothing beats the battle of Schrute Farms.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. D.P.A. sounds way more important that total deaths.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, it is. And you should read some of these letters that the soldiers wrote home. I mean, it makes the battle of Gettysburg sound like a bunch of schoolgirls wrestling over a hairbrush. [laughs] I'm telling you, they're heartbreaking too. So beautifully written.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Dwight, what are you telling this girl?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The truth.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Stop filling her head with nonsense, okay? She doesn't know any better.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oscar, I am so glad you just got here. I would've believed everything he said.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no! You're filling her head with nonsense. You and the history books. I'm telling the truth.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, thank you. All of history has been whitewashed.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Really? Why don't you tell us the real history, Gore Vidal?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I will. I don't know who that is, but I'm gonna tell you this-

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: he's a historian.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gettysburg was very important. Credit where credit is due, okay? Big, mad props to Gettysburg. Was it, however, the most northern battle of the civil war?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes, yes, yes!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not by a long shot!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, it was not!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Argh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, it was not. Was it the second-most northern?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sure! I will cede it was the second-most northernmost battle!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Erin-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Was it the northernmost? No. Get out of here, Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Get out of here!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I am so eager to hear your game-changers. Let's dig in, shall we?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: May I go first?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Raw fish- the disgusting food from Japan that Americans would never want to eat. Now, we can't get enough of it. From movie stars to construction workers, sushi is what's for dinner. Let me throw another idea at you. Origami. What? The crazy art of paper folding from, that's right, Japan. Don't you wish you could go back to 1980 and open the first sushi restaurant in Manhattan? We can do that! With... origami. It's the sushi of paper.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: This idea hasn't gripped me. What else did you come up with?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well I had to memorize the presentation, Robert, and it took a long time to build the swan, so-

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: That was bad.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: If your woman is like mine, I bet you come home to hear the same thing all the time. This paper is so hard. It scratches. Why can't there be a paper just for me? Well now there is. 'Papyr.' Paper for women. It's pink, scented and silky soft. Now, you can watch the game and she can write a letter to her sister.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: The situation you described, returning home to a wife complaining about her paper being too masculine, is not one I'm familiar with.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: In the African-American community-

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [murmurs] Thought it was worth a try.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's fascinating. Tell me, what's the significance of the peach orchard, thought?

Quote.Speaker: Park Ranger
Quote.Text: Oh, well, that's a great question. Actually some of the most-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me, I got a question for you.

Quote.Speaker: Park Ranger
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can you tell us about the battle of Schrute Farms?

Quote.Speaker: Park Ranger
Quote.Text: Uh, I haven't heard of that one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really. Okay, follow-up question. How much are they paying you to keep your mouth shut?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I apologize for my friend and for the Republicans who are cutting your funding.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We don't need to bother this poor gentleman. I know exactly where we're going. Giddy up! Tallyho!

Quote.Speaker: Chelsea
Quote.Text: [taps Gabe's shoulder] Are you Lincoln?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No, no, I'm-

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Apparently, I bear a passing resemblance to Abraham Lincoln. Makes it kind of hard for me to go to places like museums, historical monuments, elementary schools... I don't see it. Chelsea's Mom: Chelsea, give Mr. Lincoln your hat so I can take a picture.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay, Quick.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Hey! Lincoln's starting. [light applause]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh, uh, no. No, no, no, no. I'm, uh, I'm actually with a tour group myself, so- [laughter] Hello! I'm Abraham Lincoln! Some people call me the great emancipator, but, uh, you might know me from the penny. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. You know the test booklets that they give out in all the schools. I was thinking that we could put a coupon in the back that people would mail in to us... and as, you know, as I tell it, I don't like it. Unless, of course, you are responding to it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I am not.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, excuse me. I'm gonna go to the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: At this point, when you're this pregnant, it's kind of like senior spring. The other day I spit my gum out on the carpet.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Kevin, you've been quiet. I'm curious to know what your game-changer is.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, you know how in the vending machine they have the chocolate chip cookies in the A-1 spot? They do that 'cause they think A-1's the best spot for the best cookie. But the real best spot is D-4. Right? That's where the eyes go. So...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Cookies. Cookie placement.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. But not just the cookies, though. That was just a 'for instance.'

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Who else agrees with Kevin, that we're wasting facilities, manpower, on our underselling products when we should be pushing our top-performers? [everyone raises their hand, Robert laughs] There you go. Consensus.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, we are now on a planet where Kevin is the most creative person around, and I am just some good-looking guy.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [as Lincoln] I just don't understand. It's 1865, victory is ours, I've saved the very soul of our nation, and yet... happiness eludes me. Oh, perhaps a trip to the theater will enliven my spirits.

Quote.Speaker: Audience
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: 'Kay, so another thing about oatmeal cookies. Who even wants them? I mean, I've seen Toby eat one, like, once, but other than that... [scoffs] like, forget it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Interesting. So what is Dunder Mifflin's oatmeal cookie? What is the product that no one wants?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: how about that two-hole-punch letter? Only the lawyers want that punch at the top and they use legal.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: That's the oatmeal cookie. Fantastic, Kevin. Fantastic. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: By the way, did we leave all the food on the bus?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's talk about food for a second. Food for thought.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's what I had for breakfast and I think that's probably why I'm still hungry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hunger! Hunger for victory! Hunger for honor. Hunger for pride.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hunger for hamburger.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hunger for chicken chimichangas. Right, Darryl?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's good.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Exactly. Now do you know the Civil War soldiers were hungry for? Pride! Now, each battalion had its own flag and they guarded these flags with their lives. Colonel Harrison Jeffords of the Fourth Michigan Infantry saw his flag being carried away, chased it down with nothing but a sword. Fought tooth and nail at the foot of that flag until he died. He wasn't about to let them have that flag. Pride. Right, guys? [holds up flag] I commissioned this flag for Dunder Mifflin. Cost me two hundred dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Only two hundred dollars?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We are all branches on this tree. And from the tree comes paper. We're all part of a business. But business is war. What's that I hear? Uh, a rebel paper company is coming to take our flag! Wha- what's going on here? Wee-hoo! Come and get it! Who's gonna get the flag? Who's getting it? Whoa! Hey! Ho! Don't look where I am, look where I'm going. Juke right, juke left.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Andy, this is inappropriate. People died here, man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Get the flag! Get the flag! Come on, Big Tuna. What you gonna do about it? We got a flag right here. Wee-hoo!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Spangler Springs is a mile this way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh wow. So that's two miles if you incorporate the walk back.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Its... I mean come on.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't think I should walk anymore. You know all I had for breakfast was oatmeal, yogurt, coffee, orange juice and toast. Two poached eggs. And then half a sandwich on the bus.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright fine. You know what - I guess this place just hasn't rubbed off on you the way I hoped it would. I'm still going. And I'm not going to ask anymore. I'm not even going to look back. I'm just going to assume that you're with me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Andy looks back to find everyone sitting] You said you weren't going to look back.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: And why is Black Rock suddenly the paragon by which all hedge funds must now be compared?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Right. I mean you're an accountant. Those bogus prospectuses must drive you insane.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes. I am an accountant.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Dwight - this is one of the archivists here. I thought maybe we could consult him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well. Anyone employed by the Gettysburg Industrial Complex is certainly going to want to keep quiet about the Battle of Schrute Farms.

Quote.Speaker: Archivist
Quote.Text: Schrute Farms did you say? That is a fascinating little chapter of the Civil War.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You've heard about it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: YES! Ha! Prepare to be refuted! Go on.

Quote.Speaker: Archivist
Quote.Text: There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Narrator
Quote.Text: Families and sweethearts back home waited desperately for letters from the front.

Quote.Speaker: Soldier
Quote.Text: Dearest mother I'm sorry it has been so long since my last letter. It is three months since I arrived at Schrute Farms and I fear I may never leave this place alive. Melvin Fifer Garris.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hallowed ground.

Quote.Speaker: Narrator
Quote.Text: But the Battle at Schrute Farms was no battle at all. It was a code used by pacifists from both North and South who turned the Pennsylvania farmhouse into an artistic community and a refuge from the war.

Quote.Speaker: Amanda
Quote.Text: [on film] You have to understand. Poets, artists, dancers - these kind of men preferred peace to war. These delicate lovely men found a place of refuge among the Schrutes at Schrute Farms. Amidst the macho brutality of war this was a place where dandies and dreamers could put on plays and sing tender ballads and dance in the moonlight. I like to think of Schrute Farms as the Underground Railroad for the sensitive... and well... fabulous.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wow. This is so much better than the story you made up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've seen enough.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're right. There should be a monument to this.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Never trust a cookie with a woman's name. Pecan Sandy. Lorna Doone. Madeline. They'll just break your heart.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [laughing] Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Robert I hate to interrupt. But I would love to pitch you one last idea. I call it the Big Mac idea.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What?!? No!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Big Mac idea. That sounds encouraging.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's really, really good Robert. Let me explain.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No! This is not fair! This is my idea. He's trying to steal it because he's jealous of me.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well what is the idea?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Every time you buy a Big Mac you set one ingredient aside. Then at the end of the week you have a free Big Mac. And you love it even more because you made it with your own hands.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You know what? Now I remember. That was your idea. [patting Kevin on the back] That is 100 percent your idea.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oh my. It was just actually cookies the whole time?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [making pencil imprint] Dammit.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You guys came. Where's everyone else?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Back at the bus. We were locked out. Phyllis is sitting on the ground eating a dirty sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah I asked the bus driver to lock it because our stuff was in there. I guess he follows orders.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah sorry everyone else didn't come. I think they're just tired. With holes in their shoes. And they have dysentery.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Even without an audience you're still at it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Our office has a disease. And it goes by many names. Sarcasm. Snark. Wisecracks. You take things people care about and you make them feel lame about it with your jokes. That's what you did with this trip.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy - this whole idea of our situation being just like war? It's just not true. We just work at a paper company. And you're our regional manager. And guess what man? You don't have to prove anything. We like you as regional manager. Andy if you don't believe me take a look at what's on my head. I'm wearing a very pink hat. I've been getting weird looks all day because I'm pretty sure "DM does GB" means something kinda sexual. But guess who's wearing them? All of us. Just for you man. That's huge.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You don't like the hats?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: They're terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I hate myself.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They just didn't turn out how I wanted. In my head they were cooler, but they do look weird.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [voiceover the three walking] The world will little note, nor long remember the fight Jim and I had here at Gettysburg and that's good because I was basically wrong. I wanted my team to be, like, this army and I was their general. But I guess it's really more like they're just people who work in an office and I'm their manager. Yeah that's really probably a better analogy now that I think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Abe and Mary are seated watching the show. [in Lincoln voice] Oh Mary this is wonderful... Ok Mary stop your scolding. I'll be quiet. [aside to the audience] I need her like I need a hole in the head! [scattered chuckles from the crowd] [Gabe raises his hand with a finger pointed in the shape of a gun to his head] BANG! Ooh [Gabe falls to the ground and the crowd claps, Gabe picks up the Lincoln hat, bows, runs to the crowd and trades it back for his pink "DM does GB" hat and runs off]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Haha! There he is. You mind lending a hand? I'm typing up a memo to share your ideas with the board.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I can do that.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Great....ok.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Your arm feels good on my back.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: For some reason, my boss is obsessed with cookies. It's not my specialty. My specialty is pizza. But I'm flexible.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Charge!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Isn't Gettysburg like three hours away?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No. It's like two hours and forty-six minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's kind of a haul, so we should probably get going. And tuna, I made a special sandwich for you, guess which kind.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tuna?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! Tuna of the land. Turkey. With pesto.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And to drink?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Water.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh-ho, I am in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm excited, I've actually never been to Gettysburg. Uh, my family was gonna go once, but then my brothers convinced me if was full of dead soldier zombies, so I freaked out and we turned the car around. But I'm older now, I can outrun a zombie.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Getting everyone on the bus, check. Giving everyone hats, check. Sexiest eastern European girls, uh, check.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, Devil's Den is that way, we should check it out. That's where the snipers hid.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Please! Everyone and their mother goes to Devil's Den. It's the Olive Garden of Gettysburg.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, I like Olive Garden.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I meant that in a bad way. Obviously it tastes good, but it's not cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where do all the cool kids go when they come to this consecrated ground?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That is what I'm showing you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know what you guys are all thinking right now: Hey, let's go pee on the grave of some confederate soldiers, but you know what? Joke's on you. It only makes the flowers grow back more beautifully.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Best thing you can do for the deceased is to pee on their graves. Then you dance and work the urine into the root systems. Doesn't hurt to have a smile on your face, either.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Guys! Over here, we found the bus.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Open the door, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's locked.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Are you sure? Yeah, it's locked.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not locked, gimme that...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's weird, if it's not locked, why isn't it opening?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's, it's latched closed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, you know what? Andy probably has the number for this guy. I'm gonna find him.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll come with you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ow! Ee! I sat on my sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: And that's how the printing press was invented.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [enters office doing Michael Jackson impression] Everybody beat it. Don't beat it, stay where you are.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: There you are. Dillinger Graphics said their shipment is late.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What did you say?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Nothing, I just-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What would you say?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That it'll be the first shipment out today.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That is exactly the right thing to say! Do it! Git-er-done! Phyllis, you just married Joe Order, you're new name is Phyllis Order [fill this order], get it?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't get it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim, in regards to our high-five scheduled for four PM today, it has been moved up to now. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We didn't have one scheduled.
